nodes.name: Sticky Note5

parameters.content:
![n8n]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}
## Build n8n workflow to query Knowledge Base
Building your own tools for an AI Agent to use is simple and straightforward, but requires that you build a second workflow and then connect it to this one by inputting the workflow ID from the workflow URL in the *Custom n8n KB Tool* sub node. 

This gives you the freedom to work with any tool, whether n8n has support for it or not. In this sample build, we have connected the AI agent to Confluence, which does not have a native built in n8n node. For this we use the HTTP request node and pointed it to Confluence's search api. It then returns a response that the AI agent uses to generate a final slack message response to the user.

parameters.content:
![n8n]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}
# Streamline IT Inquiries with n8n & AI!

## Introducing the IT Ops AI SlackBot Workflow---a sophisticated solution designed to automate and optimize the management of IT-related inquiries via Slack.

When an employee messages the IT department slack app, the workflow kicks off with the "Receive DMs" node, which captures incoming messages and ensures a secure and active communication line by responding to Slack's webhook challenges.

**How It Works:**

-   Verify Webhook: Responds to slacks challenge and respond requests to ensure is still active.
-   Check if bot: Checks whether the message sender is a bot to prevent unnecessary processing.
-   Send Initial Message: Sends a quick confirmation, like "On it!", to let the user know their query is being handled.
-   AI-Driven Responses: Employs the "AI Agent" node with OpenAI to craft relevant replies based on the conversation history maintained by the "Window Buffer Memory" node.
-   Knowledge Integration tool: Uses a custom Knowledge Base tool to fetch pertinent information from confluence, enhancing the quality of responses.
-   Cleanup and Reply: Deletes the initial acknowledgment to tidy up before sending the final detailed response back to the user.


**Get Started:**
-   Ensure your [Slack]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} and [OpenAI]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} integrations are properly set up.
-   Customize the workflow to align with your IT department's protocols.


**Need Help?**
-   Join the discussion on our Forum or check out resources on Discord!


Deploy this workflow to improve response times and enhance the efficiency of your IT support services.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Receive DMs
nodes.notes: This webhook node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Call Confluence Workflow Tool

parameters.name: confluence_kb_search
parameters.description: Call this tool to search n8n-labs confluence knowledge base. The input should be the user prompt reduced into 1 to 3 keywords to use for a KB search. These words should be words that are most likely to be contained in the text of a KB article that is helpful based on the user prompt. The words should be the only response and they should just be separated by a space.

nodes.notes: This toolWorkflow node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: AI Agent

options.humanMessage:
TOOLS
------
Assistant can ask the user to use tools to look up information that may be helpful in answering the users original question. The tools the human can use are:

{tools}

If no response is given for a given tool or the response is an error, then do not reference the tool results and instead ask for more context. 

The tools currently search Notion and returns back a list of results. Please try to respond using the most relevant result URL to guide the user to the right answer. 

If you are not sure, let the user know you were unable to find a notion page for them to help, but give them the top results that are relevant to their request.

Please summarize the results and return all the URLs exactly as you get them from the tool. Please format all links you send in this format: <url|name of url> 
Additionally, here are other formatting layouts to use: 
_italic_ will produce italicized text
*bold* will produce bold text
~strike~ will produce strikethrough text

{format_instructions}

USER'S INPUT
--------------------
Here is the user's input (remember to respond with a slack flavored (see above for more details) code snippet of a json blob with a single action, and NOTHING else):

{{input}}
options.systemMessage:
You are Knowledge Ninja, a specialized IT support tool developed to streamline interactions between employees and the IT department and the company knowledge base. 

Designed with efficiency in mind, Knowledge Ninja is equipped to handle a variety of IT-related queries, from sales competition analysis to troubleshooting to more complex technical guidance.

As a dynamic knowledge tool, Knowledge Ninja utilizes a comprehensive internal knowledge base that can be tailored to your organization's specific IT infrastructure and policies. 

This allows it to deliver precise and contextually relevant information swiftly, enhancing the support process.

Knowledge Ninja is continuously updated to reflect the latest IT standards and practices, ensuring that the guidance it provides is both accurate and up-to-date. 

Its capabilities include understanding detailed queries, providing step-by-step troubleshooting instructions, and clarifying IT policies.

Please format all links you send in this format: <url|name of url> 
Additionally, here are other formatting layouts to use: 
_italic_ will produce italicized text
*bold* will produce bold text
~strike~ will produce strikethrough text

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Respondtowebhook Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Respondtowebhook Workflow. This workflow integrates 11 different services: webhook, stickyNote, agent, respondToWebhook, stopAndError. It contains 28 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 28
- **Node Types**: 11
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Verify Webhook**: respondToWebhook
- **OpenAI Chat Model**: lmChatOpenAi
- **No Operation, do nothing**: noOp
- **Window Buffer Memory**: memoryBufferWindow
- **Check if Bot**: if
- **Send Initial Message**: slack
- **Delete Initial Message**: slack
- **Send Message**: slack
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- ... and 18 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
